net.proteusframework.core

Class ReflectUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.ReflectUtil

  • public class ReflectUtil
extends Object
    Utilities that use reflection.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • checkFieldEquality

        public static boolean checkFieldEquality(Object orig,
                                         Object copy)
        Checks if the accessible fields in the specified objects are equivalent. This is not a substitute for implementing equals(). The objects must be of the same type.
        Parameters:
        orig - the original
        copy - the copy of the original.
        Returns:
        true if all the accessible fields are equal. False otherwise.

      • checkPropertyEquality

        public static boolean checkPropertyEquality(Object orig,
                                            Object copy)
        Checks if the properties of the specified objects are equivalent. This is not a substitute for implementing equals(). The objects must be of the same type.
        Parameters:
        orig - the original
        copy - the copy of the original.
        Returns:
        true if all the accessible properties are equal. False otherwise.

      • coerceDate

        @Nullable
 @Contract(value="_,null,_,_->null")
public static <N extends Date> N coerceDate(Class<N> desiredType,
                                                                                           Object value,
                                                                                           Locale locale,
                                                                                           TimeZone timeZone)
                                                                                    throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Coerce a value to a date/timestamp.
        Type Parameters:
        N - the desired type.
        Parameters:
        desiredType - the desired type.
        value - the value
        timeZone - the timezone that the value is in
        locale - the locale for the value
        Returns:
        the date/timestamp
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the value cannot be converted into a date/timestamp

      • coerceNumber

        @Nullable
 @Contract(value="_,null->null")
public static <N extends Number> N coerceNumber(Class<N> desiredType,
                                                                                           Number value)
                                                                                    throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Coerce a number from one number type to another.
        Type Parameters:
        N - the desired type. Currently only JRE Numbers are supported.
        Parameters:
        desiredType - the desired type.
        value - the value.
        Returns:
        the number.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the Number type is not supported or if number precision is lost.

      • coerceValue

        @Nullable
public static <DT> DT coerceValue(Class<DT> desiredType,
                                            Object value)
                                     throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Coerce a value from one type to another.
        Type Parameters:
        DT - the desired type.
        Parameters:
        desiredType - the desired type.
        value - the value.
        Returns:
        the new value or the original value if it did not need to be coerced.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the value cannot be converted to the desired type.

      • copyFields

        public static boolean copyFields(Object source,
                                 Object destination)
        Copies the accessible fields from the source object to the destination object. The source and destination must be the same class. Static fields are ignored.
        Parameters:
        source - the source.
        destination - the destination.
        Returns:
        true if all the fields were copied. Otherwise false.

      • copyFields

        public static boolean copyFields(Object source,
                                 Object destination,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Field... fields)
        Copies the values of the specified fields from the source object to the destination object. Static fields are ignored.
        Parameters:
        source - the source.
        destination - the destination.
        fields - the fields to copy.
        Returns:
        true if all the fields were copied. Otherwise false.

      • copyInstance

        @Nullable
public static Object copyInstance(Object instance)
        Attempts to create a copy of an Object. This method looks for a copy constructor. If a copy constructor cannot be found, the implementation will use Object.clone()if the class implements Cloneable. If neither a copy constructor nor clone() is available, a copy is attempted to be made via introspection. If a failure occurs, it is logged and null is returned. If reflection is used to make the copy there is no guarantee on how deep the copy will be. This implementation does not work well with anonymous classes.
        Parameters:
        instance - the object to copy. Must not be an array.
        Returns:
        the copy or null if unable to copy.

      • copyProperties

        public static void copyProperties(Object source,
                                  Object destination)
        Copies the property values of the source to the destination object by using introspection.
        Parameters:
        source - the source.
        destination - the destination.

      • deepCopyBean

        public static Object deepCopyBean(Object bean)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Deep copy a Java Bean's properties. Implemented using XMLEncoder and XMLDecoder, not intended for use where performance is critical.
        Parameters:
        bean - the Java Bean.
        Returns:
        A deep copy.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the bean cannot be copied using XMLEncode and XMLDecode.

public static <T> Constructor<T> findConstructor(Class<T> cl,
                                                           Object... args)
        Finds the first available constructor that has the same number of arguments and is assignment compatible with the passed in arguments.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type.
        Parameters:
        cl - The class in which to find a constructor.
        args - The arguments for the constructor.
        Returns:
        A constructor or null.

      • findMethod

        @Nullable
public static Method findMethod(Class<?> cl,
                                          Object... args)
        Finds a method in the specified class with the specified arguments or that best matches the arguments. This differs from Class.getMethod(String, Class[])in that it will find methods that are compatible.
        Parameters:
        cl - the class to examine.
        args - the method arguments.
        Returns:
        Method the method that was found or null.

      • findMethod

        @Nullable
public static Method findMethod(Class<?> cl,
                                          @Nullable
                                          String name,
                                          Class<?>... argumentClasses)
        Finds a method in the specified class with the specified arguments and name or that best matches the arguments. This differs from Class.getMethod(String, Class[]) in that it will find methods that are compatible. This method is expensive.
        Parameters:
        cl - the class to examine.
        argumentClasses - the argument classes
        name - the name of the method. May be null.
        Returns:
        Method the method that was found or null.

      • findMethod

        @Nullable
public static Method findMethod(Class<?> cl,
                                          @Nullable
                                          String name,
                                          @Nullable
                                          Object... args)
        Finds a method in the specified class with the specified arguments and name or that best matches the arguments. This differs from Class.getMethod(String, Class[]) in that it will find methods that are compatible. This method is expensive. The results of this method call should be saved.
        Parameters:
        cl - the class to examine.
        args - the arguments
        name - the name of the method.
        Returns:
        Method the method that was found or null.

      • getPropertyDescriptor

        @Nullable
public static PropertyDescriptor getPropertyDescriptor(Class<?> propertyClass,
                                                                 String beanPropertyName)
                                                          throws IntrospectionException
        Get the property descriptor of the class with the specified bean property name.
        Parameters:
        propertyClass - the property class.
        beanPropertyName - the bean property name.
        Returns:
        the property descriptor or null if not found.
        Throws:
        IntrospectionException - if an error occurs.

      • getPropertyDescriptorPath

        public static PropertyDescriptor[] getPropertyDescriptorPath(Class<?> propertyClass,
                                                             String beanPropertyPath,
                                                             boolean returnPartialPath)
                                                      throws IntrospectionException,
                                                             IllegalArgumentException
        Get the property descriptor path from the class with the specified bean property name.
        Parameters:
        propertyClass - the property class.
        beanPropertyPath - the bean property name. This string can be dot separated to denote properties in an object graph.
        returnPartialPath - flag to return a partial path.
        Returns:
        an array of property descriptors that represent the path that corresponds to the dot separated path specified in beanPropertyName.
        Throws:
        IntrospectionException - if an error occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path is invalid and the returnPartialPath parameter is false.

        Instantiate with a no-arg constructor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type.
        Parameters:
        klazz - the class to instantiate.
        instantiationErrorMessage - message on error.
        Returns:
        the instance.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - on error including the specified error message.

      • invokeMethod

        @Nullable
public static Object invokeMethod(Object obj,
                                            String methodName,
                                            Object... args)
        Invokes a method on an object.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method to invoke.
        obj - The object to invoke the method on.
        args - optional arguments to pass to the method.
        Returns:
        The value the method returns or null if the method returns null or if the invocation throws an exception.

      • readPropertyPath

        public static Object readPropertyPath(Object object,
                                      String beanPropertyPath,
                                      boolean returnNullOnNullPathElement)
                               throws IntrospectionException,
                                      IllegalArgumentException
        Apply the property descriptor path to the specified object.
        Parameters:
        object - the object.
        beanPropertyPath - the bean path - can include methods that aren't java bean properties.
        returnNullOnNullPathElement - true to return null on null path element. Otherwise an NPE is thrown.
        Returns:
        the object returned from calling the read method for each property.
        Throws:
        IntrospectionException - if an error occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path is invalid.

      • readPropertyPath

        public static Object readPropertyPath(Object object,
                                      String beanPropertyPath,
                                      @Nullable
                                      Map<String,?> argumentMap,
                                      boolean returnNullOnNullPathElement)
                               throws IntrospectionException,
                                      IllegalArgumentException
        Apply the property descriptor path to the specified object. Example property paths:
        • object=Runtime.class, beanPropertyPath="getRuntime.freeMemory"
        • object=System.class, beanPropertyPath="getenv[name]" or "getenv.get[name]" with a argumentMap containing a "name" value.
        • object="fooburger", beanPropertyPath= "toString.substring[beginIndex][endIndex].concat[theking]", args = {beginIndex:3, endIndex:9, theking:"king"}. If the argument map is a LinkedHashMap, the following beanPropertyPath will also work, "toString.substring[0][1].concat[2]".
        Parameters:
        object - the object.
        beanPropertyPath - the bean path - can include methods that aren't java bean properties.
        argumentMap - a mapping of arguments. If arguments can be indexed based, then the map should be something like a LinkedHashMap. Index access is a fallback.
        returnNullOnNullPathElement - true to return null on null path element. Otherwise an NPE is thrown.
        Returns:
        the object returned from calling the read method for each property.
        Throws:
        IntrospectionException - if an error occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the path is invalid.

      • setFieldValue

        public static void setFieldValue(Object object,
                                 String fieldName,
                                 @Nullable
                                 Object fieldValue)
        Get a field value.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field name.
        fieldValue - the field value.
        object - the object.

      • setPropertyFromString

        public static void setPropertyFromString(Object obj,
                                         String parm)
                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets public properties of the given object from the string parm using setter method. The parm argument is in the format "prop=value[,prop=value]*". The property type is checked and the value converted. Primitives and java.lang.String are directly supported. Other classes must either have a constructor that takes a single java.lang.String argument or a static Object valueOf(java.lang.String) method. Property/value separator can be a comma or semicolon. HTML entities are used for escaping. Static fields (i.e. constants) can be referenced in numerical values.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object.
        parm - the name value parameter.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Cannot find a property or property is readonly.
